messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] HOW many days a year in Kentucky?
messages.msgSnippet: ... But you know what, I would have no problem filling out their form saying I would do 275 days. From an unschooling perpective, we re *on* 24/7, 365 days a
messages.messageBody:
>>I hope it is a typo because that is the law in North Carolina as well. I
>>just about died!! I'm thinking I will have to try to talk to someone on
>>the phone for clarification. And why would hs-ers have 275 when ps-ers
>>have 180 (or something like that)??? WEIRD!>>


But you know what, I would have no problem filling out their form saying I
would do 275 days. From an unschooling perpective, we're *on* 24/7, 365 days
a year. I don't care if it looks like school to them. It's not supposed to
look like school. My kids are learning and I can justify whatever arbitrary
amount they come up with.

~Mary, who's thinking that in her next move out of state, registering will
be optional.

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] HOW many days a year in Kentucky?
messages.msgSnippet: I hope it is a typo because that is the law in North Carolina as well.  I just about died!!  I m thinking I will have to try to talk to someone on the phone
messages.messageBody:
I hope it is a typo because that is the law in North Carolina as well. I
just about died!! I'm thinking I will have to try to talk to someone on the
phone for clarification. And why would hs-ers have 275 when ps-ers have 180
(or something like that)??? WEIRD!

DiAnna

messages.subject: HOW many days a year in Kentucky?
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/28/02 8:16:06 AM, sharonve@aol.com writes:  Are you sure that s not 175 days, not 275?   275
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/28/02 8:16:06 AM, sharonve@... writes:

<< homeschool for 275 days of the year >>

Are you sure that's not 175 days, not 275? 275 doesn't even leave weekends.

I'm guessing it was a typo.

Sandra
